Expectation1: Ensuring financial stability for the family
Situation1: The family requires money for daily living expenses, and the father needs to provide it
Situation2: They skim a recent pharmacy newsletter while on break to see what new drugs have been released.
Story: I sat in the cramped break room, my lunch untouched, eyes scanning the latest pharmacy newsletter. New drugs, new protocols—so much to keep up with. My mind wandered to the bills waiting at home, the groceries we needed, the shoes my daughter had outgrown. I knew I had to stay sharp at work, keep up with the changes, or risk falling behind. But every minute I spent reading about new medications felt like a minute stolen from figuring out how to stretch our budget, how to make sure my family had what they needed. My phone buzzed with a message from my wife: “Can you pick up milk and bread on your way home?” I felt the weight of both worlds pressing in—my duty to provide, and my responsibility to be the best pharmacist I could. I stared at the newsletter, the words blurring, torn between the demands of my profession and the needs of my family, unsure which to put first.
